intro: Inversodicraea variabilis, commonly known as the variable inversodicraea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
